main event: Multiple large, bright, and steady objects were observed on radar, traveling at high speeds and accelerating out of range in a sighting that lasted about 30-45 minutes, confirmed by three highly experienced operators.
interesting points: The objects were seen at an altitude of 30,000 feet, descending to 20,000 feet, and then accelerating out of range, exhibiting unusual movements and characteristics unlike typical aircraft returns.
Observations were made on an air traffic control radar set, adding credibility to the sighting.
The radar blips from the objects were unusually bright and steady.
The data obtained from this sighting was deemed to be of investigative value.
Another sighting reported a real, white and green object, resembling the size and shape of a football, glowing and descending over 45 minutes, with the observer initially identifying it as a star.
sighted object: multiple large, bright, and steady objects on radar, and a real, white and green glowing object resembling the size and shape of a football
witnesses: three highly experienced radar operators, and a ground radar observer
